comments.body: cc @deads2k, will this work after we register internal objects to their respective groups (e.g., an internal object in Extensions group is registered using `Scheme.AddKnownTypes("Extensions/", ...)`)?

Probably it's ok. We register the ListOptions here because we need to generate the conversion function between unversioned.ListOptions and v1.ListOptions. Because we don't have ListOptions in other groups, so we don't need to register unversioend.ListOptions in other groups.
Yes - this will work. Also, if we need to register ListOptions in "extensions", this will also work correctly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +70,74 @@
	// Register Unversioned types
	Scheme.AddKnownTypes("", &unversioned.ListOptions{})
	Scheme.AddKnownTypes("", &unversioned.Status{})
	Scheme.AddKnownTypes("", &unversioned.APIVersions{})
